results.title: Arthropods: animal life
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The joint-legged animals and the structural and functional characteristics of animals in the phylum Arthropoda; examples from each of the five classes, and their evolutionary development. Metamorphosis and moulting processes are illustrated using photomicrography and time-lapse photography. The economic importance of this class of animals is also discussed.

results.title: Arthritis: a dialogue with pain
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall, William Weintraub, Roman Kroitor and Susan Huycke
results.brief_description: A film about arthritis, its effect upon people’s lives, the nature of the disease, and how it can be combated. Through the stories of people suffering from arthritis—young and old, mildly to severely afflicted—and interviews with medical professionals, this documentary provides answers to widely asked questions. It is also about pain and the will to conquer pain.

results.title: Artfest: where do we go from here
results.creator_credit: Esau Reuben, Papua New Guinea. Office of Information and Gary Kildea
results.brief_description: A film which looks at the determination, of the people of Papua New Guinea, to preserve their different cultures. Lifestyles have drastically changed with many people now living in the towns and leaving their village customs behind. This film concentrates on an arts festival which aimed to present traditional ideas and also to incorporate new ones.

results.title: Arteries of life
results.creator_credit: George E. Brewer Jnr and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Earth”.
Water and forests are shown as important elements in the “chain of life”. It is demonstrated that topsoil is helpless in supplying and sustaining life unless aided by water, and that water itself depends on forests which provide humus in the soil to store and regulate the flow of water.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

results.title: Art, people, feelings
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford Film Productions, Pyramid Films and Paul Burnford
results.brief_description: The relationship between human emotions and the art created is illustrated by a selection of artistic works which span all periods of history and a variety of subjects. Shows ways in which artists use many materials and methods to translate their personal feelings into visual forms: murals, landscapes, portraits, posters, billboards, abstract paintings, cartoons, pop art, sculpture and motion pictures. Suitable for secondary level years 7-12.

results.title: Art to the people
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the process engravers and the printers who produce each year the calendar of reproductions of wining entries in the Dunlop Art Contest. The film illustrates all stages in the production of the calendar from the photographing of the original material by the process engraver to the final wrapping of the printed article. The film also illustrates the opportunities for apprenticeship in the printing industry.

results.title: Art survives the times
results.brief_description: A record of art life in France. Leading artists such as Matisse, Picasso, Ultrillo and the sculptors, Roualt, Laurens and Janniot, are shown at work. The architects, Le Corbusier and Perret, also display plans for homes and cities. No other credits available.

results.title: Art since pop
results.brief_description: A general survey of the major developments in US painting and sculpture in the 70’s, following the emergence of Pop Art. Part 1 discusses hard-edge painting, minimalism, shaped canvasses, industrial processes, environmental sculptures and earthworks. It features the work of painters Barnet Newman, Ellsworth Kelly, Mark Rothko, Charles Hinman, Frank Stella and Kenneth Noland, and of sculptors Donald Judd and Christo. Part 2 concentrates on Op art and its interest in illusions of motion, kinetic art, neon and fluorescent art, video art, happenings, holograms and lasers.

Part 2 concentrates on Op art and its interest in illusions of motion, kinetic art, neon and fluorescent art, video art, happenings, holograms and lasers.

results.title: Art of the western world
results.creator_credit: Tony Cash, Andrew Snell, Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: Traces the history of art from the ancient Greek classical style, to the modern era. Focuses on painting, sculpture and architecture, highlighting the critical works and achievements of the artists of each period. Michael Wood narrates, and renowned art historians give their insight into the history of art.
